section.title: Liberty Features
section.p: Core features in the OpenStack Foundationâ€™s Liberty release (as identified below) are enabled in the standard settings and are included in Helion standard product support.

Non-core services (listed in the Features tables below) are provided as-is. Some non-core services are included in this release to provide early access to features that HPE may support fully in future releases, but HPE cannot guarantee that support will be provided or issues resolved in a future release. Other non-core features are provided in this release for a limited time and may be deprecated in future releases. HPE will attempt to provide guidance and telephone support for these features at its discretion. If you need additional support on any of these features for a specific use case, please contact the Helion professional services team.
section.note: An asterisk (*) in a table cell denotes a new feature.

section.title: Nova Features
section.p: Nova (Compute Service) implements services and associated libraries to provide massively scalable, on demand, self service access to compute resources, including bare metal, virtual machines, and containers.
section.note: The nova-docker driver is recognized by the Nova compute-manager but is maintained outside the Nova code base in StackForge and so is officially unsupported by the Nova project.

section.title: Neutron Features
section.p: Neutron (Networking Service) implements services and associated libraries to provide on-demand, scalable, and technology-agnostic network abstraction.
This content is still in progress and has not been updated for RC.

section.title: Glance Features
section.p: Glance (Image Service) provides a service where users can upload and discover data assets that are meant to be used with other services, like images for Nova and templates for Heat.
This content is still in progress and has not been updated for RC.

section.title: Swift Features
section.p: Swift (Object Storage service) is a highly available, distributed, eventually consistent object/blob store. Organizations can use Swift to store lots of data efficiently, safely, and cheaply.

section.title: Cinder Features
section.p: Cinder (Block Storage service) implements services and libraries to provide on-demand, self-service access to Block Storage resources via abstraction and automation on top of other block storage devices.

row.entry: Add/Remove Volumes from an existing consistency group
Create a Consistency Group from an existing Consistency Group snapshot
Fine tuned how the scheduler will choose a volume backend
Schema upgrades will not require restarting Cinder services right away *

section.title: Ceph Features
section.p: Ceph (Object Storage) is a fully open source distributed object store, network block device, and file system.

section.title: Keystone Features
section.p: Keystone (Identity service) facilitates API client authentication, service discovery, distributed multi-tenant authorization, and auditing.

row.entry: LDAP Administration with DB backend via new Domain admin API

section.title: Ceilometer Features
section.p: Ceilometer (Data Collection service) efficiently collects, normalise and transform data produced by OpenStack services.

section.title: Heat Features
section.p: Heat (Orchestration service) orchestrates composite cloud applications using a declarative template format through an OpenStack-native REST API.

row.entry: Generate a Template in HOT format *
Show types available to user (filter by name, version, support_staus) *
Monitor the Deployed Heat Engine Status
ResourceGroup update_policy now supports specifying batch_create and rolling_update options *

section.title: Ironic Features
section.p: Ironic (Bare Metal service) an OpenStack service and associated libraries capable of managing and provisioning physical machines, and to do this in a security-aware and fault-tolerant manner.

section.title: Horizon Features
section.p: Horizon (Dashboard) provides an extensible unified web based user interface for all OpenStack services.

row.entry: Keystone v3 for Horizon enabled by default *

section.title: Monasca Features
section.p: Monasca (Monitoring) provides a multi-tenant, highly scalable, performant, fault-tolerant monitoring-as-a-service solution for metrics, complex event processing and logging.
This content is still in progress and has not been updated for RC.

section.title: Freezer Features *
section.p: Freezer (Backup, Restore, and Disaster Recovery service) provides integrated tools for backing up and restoring cloud data in multiple use cases, including disaster recovery. These resources include file systems, server instances, volumes, and databases.
Freezer is all new for the Liberty release.

section.title: Barbican Features *
section.p: Barbican (Key Manager service) produces a secret storage and generation system capable of providing key management for services wishing to enable encryption features.
Barbican is all new for the Liberty release.
